etymology.description: 山(山) (shān, "mountain") + 與(与) (yǔ, phonetic) = landform like a mountain + sound -> islet
etymology.interpretation: With 山(山) (shān, "mountain") indicating a landform and 與(与) (yǔ) providing the pronunciation, the character depicts an enclosed land area like a mountain surrounded by water, thus representing an islet.
etymology.simplification: 嶼(嶼)→屿(嶼): 與(与) (yǔ, "and") simplified to 与(与), which shares the same pronunciation.

examples.chinese: 这个屿(這個嶼)风景如画(風景如畫)。
海上有一座屿(海上有一座嶼)，附近住着渔民(附近住着漁民)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎishàng yǒuyī zuò yǔ, fùjìn zhùzhe yúmín.
examples.english: There is an islet on the sea, near which fishermen live.
